definition: Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
man
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
surname Wu
martial/military
emperor

sentences.english: Yuan Ding five years, Emperor Li westbound parade to the Dazu County, and the temporary return of the Yellow River.
sentences.chinese: 元鼎五年，汉武帝西行巡游到达祖厉县，临黄河而返。

sentences.english: Pleasant with the good news, Emperor Wu promoted Chen as a reward.
sentences.chinese: 汉武帝很高兴，就提拔陈步乐为郎官。

sentences.english: As a great intelligent and capable emperor, Han Wudi had made many more achievements than mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 汉武帝一生雄才大略，他的功绩远远大于他的过失。

sentences.english: Anxious to find a way to save his city, the emperor asked Dongfang Shuo what he should do.
sentences.chinese: 为了拯救长安城，汉武帝问东方朔该怎么办。

sentences.english: Part ii , the animadversion to Hanwu emperor's regnant policy at Salt-iron conference .
sentences.chinese: 盐铁会议对汉武帝内外统治政策的批判。

sentences.english: Minyue culture is the culture formed by the people in Minyue from the Spring and Autumn Period to the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 闽越文化即春秋战国至汉武帝时期闽越人创造的文化。

sentences.english: Since the Han Dynasty began, the vertical Yubei 16 buildings.
sentences.chinese: 自汉武帝始，历代立御碑16幢。

sentences.english: Of course, Emperor Wudi could see that Ji An was complaining.
sentences.chinese: 汉武帝当然听得出这是发牢骚。

definition: Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC

Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
Liu Heng (202-157 BC), the fourth Han emperor Han Wendi, reigned 180-157 BC
Qin Ershi (229-207 BC), second Qin emperor
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
King Huiwen of Qin 秦國|秦国, ruled 338-211 BC during the Warring States Period
Li Ling (-74 BC), Han dynasty general whose defeat by the Xiongnu 匈奴 in 104 BC led to a major scandal
Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
Tang Emperor Xuanzong (685-762), also known as Emperor Ming of Tang 唐明皇[Tang2 Ming2 huang2], reign name of seventh Tang emperor 李隆基[Li3 Long1 ji1], reigned 712-756
